sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"社团，会社，协会"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: club, association, institute, league, union, society
means: club ： 表俱乐部或会社，其成员因志同道合，有共同兴趣、爱好而组织到一起进行社交、娱乐或体育等活动。
association ： 指较为正式的组织，强调兴趣和需要的一致性。
institute ： 指为专门的目标而建立的学会或研究所。
league ： 指为了共同的目的和利益而组成的社团、同盟或联合会。
union ： 多指工会，也指学会或协会。
society ： 可与association换用，但前者的宗旨更严格，会员之间联系更紧密，活动更积极。

sentence.Network_en: The club has moved its meeting to Saturday, January 22nd.

sentence.Network_en: This season the club has had 73,500 season-ticket holders.
sentence.Network_cn: 本赛季该俱乐部已经有73,500名持有季票的观众。

sentence.Network_en: People at the club think very highly of him.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...新创例如：“制纸”、“制糖”、“民族”……少数形音兼具的音译（在汉语中，可能声音的成分已经难以察觉）, “俱乐部（club）”、“目录（catalogue）”、“组织（sosiki）”等等。, 其中，抽象化汉语原有词汇的部份，原先虽为汉语，但现今使用的意义已经截然不同，一般也认定属于和制汉语。.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (as a verb): formed obscurely from club
Middle English: from Old Norse clubba, variant of klumba; related to clump

encyclopedia.content: club译为俱乐部，新造词汇又称可乐部，就是由企业经营者或个人出面组织，会员在自愿、互助、互惠的基础上自主参加，并有相应的权利和义务的自由协会或团体。“俱乐部”这个词是日本人对英文Club的音译。

entry.def: A club is an organization of people interested in a particular activity or subject who usually meet on a regular basis.

entry.tran: 俱乐部会所；俱乐部活动场所
entry.def: A club is a place where the members of a club meet.

example.ex: I stopped in at the club for a drink.
example.tran: 我顺路到俱乐部喝了一杯。

entry.def: A club is a team which competes in sporting competitions.

example.tran: 纽约扬基职业棒球俱乐部

entry.def: A club is the same as a nightclub .

example.ex: It's a big dance hit in the clubs.
example.tran: 这支舞曲在夜总会很火。

entry.def: A club is a long, thin, metal stick with a piece of wood or metal at one end that you use to hit the ball in golf.
A club is a thick heavy stick that can be used as a weapon.

example.ex: Men armed with knives and clubs attacked his home.
example.tran: 一群手持刀棒的人袭击了他家。

entry.def: To club a person or animal means to hit them hard with a thick heavy stick or a similar weapon.

example.ex: Two thugs clubbed him with baseball bats...
example.tran: 两个暴徒用棒球棒猛击他。

example.ex: Clubbing baby seals to death for their pelts is wrong.
example.tran: 为了获得海豹皮而用棍棒打死幼海豹是不道德的。

entry.def: Clubs is one of the four suits in a pack of playing cards. Each card in the suit is marked with one or more black symbols: ♣.

means.word_mean: 1. a team of professional baseball players who play and travel together;

sentences.sentence: "each club played six home games with teams in its own division"

means.word_mean: 2. a formal association of people with similar interests;

sentences.sentence: "men from the fraternal order will staff the soup kitchen today"

means.word_mean: 3. stout stick that is larger at one end;

sentences.sentence: "he carried a club in self defense"
"he felt as if he had been hit with a club"

means.word_mean: 4. a building occupied by a club;
5. golf equipment used by a golfer to hit a golf ball
6. a playing card in the minor suit of clubs (having one or more black trefoils on it);
7. a spot that is open late at night and that provides entertainment (as singers or dancers) as well as dancing and food and drink;

sentences.sentence: "don't expect a good meal at a cabaret"
"the gossip columnist got his information by visiting nightclubs every night"
"he played the drums at a jazz club"

means.word_mean: 3. strike with a club or a bludgeon

Members of the 4-H club agreed to follow the project through to completion, because they receive satisfaction from the results of constructive work
What do the 4-H club members do about the curbside?

Would you like to join our gardening club?
He declines to join the gardening club

sentences.cn: 他们为贫穷的孩子们募集了一笔资金。

sentences.en: The students clubbed together to buy their teacher a present.
sentences.cn: 学生们凑钱给他们的老师买了件礼物。

jushi.chinese: 网球俱乐部组织了一次舞会。

jushi.english: Anyone who can speak French is eligible to join the club.
